text:
Bundesliga
Frankfurt - Bayern Munich: "We do not have the right to lose like that"
After the defeat in Frankfurt (5-1), Bayern Munich coach Niko Kovac came back on the rout of his team outnumbered.
02 Nov 2019, 22:00 by Charlie Creteur



The Bavarians had a dirty afternoon in Frankfurt! In the 9th minute of play, Niko Kovac's players saw their defender Jerome Boateng sent off. In the wake, they conceded 2 goals (25th and 33rd) before closing the gap of Robert Lewandowski (37th) before the break. In the second half, the numerical inferiority was right of them conceding 3 other goals (49th, 61st, 85th). A defeat on the score of 5-1 which does not please at all the coach of the champion of Germany.




"It's disappointing and annoying"




Robert Lewandowski + 17 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

"It's not that easy today," he said. "The match went exactly the way we did not want to, it's hard to get out of the game, but even with one man missing, you do not have the right to lose like that." It's disappointing and annoying. ". The Bavarians will have to react next week in the Champions League against Olympiakos.
